alert.note: Alert for Baker; Bradford; Gilchrist; Hamilton; Suwannee; Union (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 01 at 11:57AM EDT until September 06 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of Florida, including the following areas, Baker, Bradford, Central Marion, Eastern Alachua, Gilchrist, Hamilton, Northern Columbia, Southern Columbia, Suwannee, Union, Western Alachua and Western Marion. Portions of southeast Georgia, including the following areas, Clinch and Echols. * WHEN...Until 11 PM EDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Afternoon and evening thunderstorm activity may cause localized flash flooding over already saturated grounds over the Suwannee River Valley and I-75 corridor due to Hurricane Idalia. Rainfall amounts of up to 2-4 inches can be expected in a short time frame in thunderstorm activity. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Baker; Bradford; Gilchrist; Hamilton; Suwannee; Union
